intro: Dolicholobium acuminatum, commonly known as the slender-lobed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their toxic sap. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its stems are typically hairy and can grow up to several feet in height. Dolicholobium acuminatum is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
